mdRecord.dcterms:title: A new map of Germany, Hungary, Transilvania & the Suisse cantons: with many remarks not extant in any map / According to ye newest and most exact observations, by Herman Moll Geographer, 1712
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Moll, Herman, -1732 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map : col. ; 61 x 100 on sheet 63 x 107.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Dedication: To His Grace John Duke of Marleborough, Prince of Mindelheim &c. This map of Germany &c. is most Humbly Dedicated by H. Moll Geographer. [original]
Note: The several countries contained in this map yeilding many natural advantages, as gold, silver, copper, lead and iron mines; salt springs &c ... [original]

Note: The Emperor has 200 ships and gallies, on the Danube fo ye defence of ye Kingdom of Hungary and ye Turks as many; so that there never were such large fleets, and so great navel engagements, any where at such a distance from the sea as in the late war on that river. [original]
Pictorial inset: The general Diet of the Empire, or it's parliament with ye order of it's different colleges ... [original]

Below title: Note, that in this map are comprehended these dominions belonging to ye House of Austria viz Bohemia, Silesia, Austria, Hungary, Transilvania, Stiria, Carinthia and Carniola, Principality of Swabia, Tirol &c. Also the ecclesiasticall and secular electorates, all the states and sovereignties in Swabia, Franconia, Hessia, Westphalia & Saxony. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: "Germany" is handwritten in brown ink on the verso. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Europe, Central--Maps--Early works to 1800
